from notebookutils import mssparkutils
### mount the data lake storage in Synapse to the Synapse File Mount API
jobId = mssparkutils.env.getJobId()
storage_acc_name = spark.sparkContext.environment.get('dataLakeAccountName', 'get')
mssparkutils.fs.unmount("/ims_items") 
mssparkutils.fs.mount( 
"abfss://odw-raw@"+storage_acc_name+".dfs.core.windows.net/IMS/API-Data/",
"/ims_items", 
{"linkedService":"ls_storage"}

import json
import pandas as pd
import csv
with open(f"/synfs/{jobId}/ims_items/IMS_ropa.json", "r",encoding='utf-8') as inputfile:
    ims_dict = json.load(inputfile)
    # print(ims_dict)
    # print(ims_dict["data"])
    for items in ims_dict["data"]:
        df = items['attributes']
        # print(df)
        with open(f"/synfs/{jobId}/ims_items/IMS_ropa.csv", 'w', encoding='UTF8') as f:
            writer = csv.writer(f)

            # write the header
            writer.writerow(items['attributes'].keys())

            # write the data
            writer.writerow(items['attributes'].values())

# df.to_csv('IMS_ropa.csv', encoding='utf-8', index=False)
with open(f"/synfs/{jobId}/ims_items/IMS_ropa.csv", "r",encoding='utf-8') as outputfile:
    ims_csv = csv.load(outputfile)
    print(ims_csv)

with open(f"/synfs/{jobId}/ims_items/IMS_ropa.csv", "r",encoding='utf-8') as outputfile:
    ims_csv = csv.reader(outputfile)
    print(ims_csv)
